summary: The state of Texas is divided into 254 counties.
full_text:
McCulloch County is a county located on the Edwards Plateau in the U.S. state of Texas. At the 2010 census, its population was 8,283. Its county seat is Brady. The county was created in 1856 and later organized in 1876. It is named for Benjamin McCulloch, a famous Texas Ranger and Confederate general.
The geographical center of Texas lies within McCulloch County, near Brady.
^ "State & County QuickFacts". United States Census Bureau. Retrieved December 21, 2013. 
^ "Find a County". National Association of Counties. Retrieved 2011-06-07. 
^ "Texas: Individual County Chronologies". Texas Atlas of Historical County Boundaries. The Newberry Library. 2008. Retrieved May 25, 2015. 
^ "Environment". Texas Almanac. Texas State Historical Association. Retrieved May 3, 2014.
title: McCulloch County, Texas
